venue.name: Artesani Playground in Herter Park DCR (formerly MDC)

item.description:
Feliz Dia da Independencia!

Let's join the Brazilian Independence celebration organized by the Brazilian Women's Group. Bring cash so you can purchase tasty food from the vendors.

Of course you're free to get there when you can and hang as long as you're able on your own but if you want to be with the group, call or text my cell (617) 445-7549 if you need help finding us.

Handicap accessible

Where to park FREE of charge:

• 1300 Soldiers Field Rd, Boston MA

• 1120 Soldiers Field Rd, Boston MA

• 43 Holton St, Boston MA (St Anthony's)

Parking in front of DCR Herter Park (1175 Soldiers Field Road) will be reserved solely for Festival vendors and organizers

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit.

 

Attractions:
• 12 pm Official opening – performance of the Brazilian National Anthem

• Festival Opening Parade with Marcus Santos and AfroBrazil

• Children’s activities (face painting and drawing)

• Boston Museum of Science

• New England Aquarium

• Ethnic food, Information and Service Stands

 

Live Performances:
- The Sergio Mendes Project: To Sergio with Love
- Nanny Assis
- Capoeira Sinhá
- Forrózuê Band
- Children’s Play “The Three Little Pigs”
• Art installation with artist Lineu Zadereski
